page.title: 16THE YEAVELEY SHOOT
page.content: My uncle owns the Yeaveley shoot. The guns they use are 12 bore shot guns. You have to be 17 to have a licence for a shot gun, but you can shoot or trap when you are 11 or 12. My uncle teaches people how to shoot as well. It costs Â£3.80 for a session at the shoot, which includes using a gun and as many clay pigeons as you like. At the shoot they never shoot live animals or birds. Instead they use clay pigeons which are round pieces of clay, they have big ones and small ones. My uncle goes on shooting trips abroad and then he shoots animals like moose and deer.
